entries.content: Session started with Moti. Refreshed memory on Sementix project - VS Code extension transforming Claude Code terminal experience into visual collaborative UI. Recent work includes ultra-modular refactoring, permission system, React dashboard. Git status shows work in progress on UI indicators (CSS files) and IDE dashboard components.

CRITICAL LESSON LEARNED: Previous agent sessions repeatedly broke the indicator CSS system by:
1. Not using memory search FIRST when encountering errors
2. Making changes without understanding the full system
3. Breaking positioning and causing huge orange asterisks
User was extremely frustrated. MUST search memory and understand before making ANY changes to CSS.
User wants to change .loader-wrapper size from 80px to 40px (both width and height). This is a simple size adjustment to make the DNA helix indicator smaller.
User wants to adjust the SVG size for the Codex indicator specifically.

User wants to change DNA helix animation to circular orbit pattern: two orbits with dots moving in opposite directions (clockwise and counter-clockwise). This is a significant animation redesign from the current DNA helix pattern.
User wants SVG to appear on top of the orbiting dots. Need to ensure SVG z-index is higher than dots z-index.

User reports dots are still appearing over the logo despite z-index settings. The SVG has z-index: 10 in the provider-specific CSS files, dots have z-index: 1. Need to investigate why z-index isn't working - likely a stacking context issue.
Z-index not working even with z-index: 100. User suspects it might be HTML element order issue. Need to check the template HTML files to see the DOM structure and order of elements.

Fixed z-index issue by moving SVG element BEFORE the dots in HTML template. DOM order matters - elements later in the DOM render on top regardless of z-index when using position: absolute in same stacking context.
User wants to restructure HTML: 1) Wrap SVG + dots in a div (animation wrapper), 2) Wrap that div + text in another div with flex layout. This will allow better layout control with flexbox.

Successfully redesigned indicator system with circular orbit animation:
- Changed loader size from 80px to 40px
- Created two circular orbits (outer 15px clockwise, inner 8px counter-clockwise) with 8 dots total
- Fixed z-index layering by moving SVG before dots in HTML template
- Restructured HTML with flex layout: .indicator-container wraps .loader-wrapper (animation) and .loading-text
- Animation and text now display horizontally side-by-side with 12px gap
User confirmed it looks great!

Planning to integrate shimmer text effect from text-temp/text-loaders/7-shimmer into the indicator system. Need to make it modular and organized following the ultra-modular CSS pattern we use in the project. User wants proper separation of JS, CSS, and HTML for future text effects.
User confirmed to proceed with shimmer effect integration. Wants a dedicated folder for shimmer effect as there will be more text effects later. This confirms the modular extensible approach.

IMPORTANT: User clarified that the shimmer effect already exists in text-temp/text-loaders/7-shimmer files and should NOT be changed. We need to integrate it AS-IS into the indicator system, just organizing it into the proper folder structure without modifying the effect itself.
